intro: Senecio organensis f. albiflorus, commonly known as the whiteflower senecio, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinguishing trait is the white to pale yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters. It is often found in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions.
